Reviews.Title: “3-star only because of location”
Reviews.Author: indegloria
Reviews.Content: The information in these reviews are correct. This is not a 4-star hotel. I say this not because this is an older hotel with small rooms, I like hotels with charm and character. But this one definitely needs some upgrading. Street side you are not going to get much sleep with busy traffic and no double glass to keep the noise out. Ask for inside rooms if you're staying here. The shower in the bath is old so dont expect generous amounts of water, although the water that comes out is warm. There was no safe to keep my valuables (I was in 212) but reception was nice to keep a bag for me. Wifi is 10 euro for a day and 5 euro for every next day. The system kicked me out however every time my ipad went to black so I had to reenter the code dozens of times. Breakfast room is impressive but breakfast selection is limited, on the upside they have very good fresh croissants. Finally, on the positive side, staff is helpful and speaks quite good English. If you're looking for places to eat, dont turn left towards fontana di trevi, you will find tourist places only. Go to the roundabout and follow the narrow street in front (via panisperna), walk to the Via di Serpenti and turn right, lots of nice shops and restaurants in this area. I had dinner at a trattoria at Via Leonina. The hotel also recommends Restaurant Petrucci, on the roundabout turn left Via 24 Maggio and then its in the first alley on the left: Via della Cordonata.

Reviews.Title: “almost good, almost exelent”
Reviews.Author: kiropraktor
Reviews.Content: To start with, it is on a very good location-close to everything. Rooms are nice and clean, but not very spacious. Bathroom is quite small, and be very cearfull ander the shower, because hot and cold water is not mixing steady the same. Breakfast is very good for average hotel. Staff is nice and helpfull enough but not overwellming. By my judgement this is an exelent 3 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location EVER”
Reviews.Author: julia260561
Reviews.Content: Before I go any further, this hotel was probably in the best location in Rome. Night time when we arrived so wern't really aware of where we were until the morning, and what a great surprise. 5 min walk from the Forum and Colloseum (well we do walk fast), and 10 minute walk from just about everywhere else. Absolutely perfect situation. The hotel itself looks very impressive on first arriving and the room was spotlessly clean with clean towels each day, however the room we were in overlooked a very spooky disused hotel with old air conditioning units and a dodgy smell so we didn't open the window, in fact we didn't look out as it was so hideous. Shower was brilliant, but the bath to stand in was the width of my foot so if mobility problems then could be tricky. Very small bathroom and couldn't open the door fully because the towel rail and bidet were behind it so if bigger than a size 14 you probably wouldn't squeeze in. However, it was clean and enough towels. we did have a small 'ant' problem but the staff sorted that out quickly. The room wasn't for relaxing, no tea, coffee etc and no view (as mentioned earlier) so consequently after 12 hours walking we didn't want to go back for a rest so we ended up sitting in cafes or on benches until bed time, this was actually a bit of a pain, but we managed. The TV was also a problem, we couldnt work it out, asked the staff who came and helped, but then it was all in Italian !!! too much bother to get him back so we sat staring at the walls for a while until we fell asleep. No noise from our room but thats because we were facing the air conditioning units !!!!. Breakfast was fine, usual continental fayre, nice coffee, nice bread and cheeses. Overall the hotel was OK but very dated and shabby with a strange smell. . Only met 3 staff who were a little brusque but we wern't there to be friendly and saw no other guests apart from 1, we actually thought the hotel was a bit spooky. Had a great time, wouldn't stay at this hotel again, but it was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Great location ...”
Reviews.Author: chipuba
Reviews.Content: ... making it so easy to walk to all the fantastic sights and monuments - Rome is fantastic! However, for a 4 star hotel it was a bit lacking. Our shower was iffy, the breakfast rolls were not the freshest and they kept running out of croissants (brioches) and the noise from our front bedroom was horrendous - even using ear plugs! Although we got a good bargain and didn't pay the full price, some people must and I think they would be disappointed. But it IS a fantastic location and you are in Rome so ...! Great traditional restaurant 2 mins away called Melo - great hospitality and food.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic break made better by a great location”
Reviews.Author: Grantrs4
Reviews.Content: I booked this for a surprise birthday trip for my wife and I. Having no previous experience of Rome, I took a bit of a punt with this one using the reviews and the location map! We were not at all disapointed. The hotel is in a great location directly across the road from the Roman Forum. A 10 minute walk will get you to the Colloseum (perhaps longer, as the is so much to take in along the way). Turn right as you leave the hotel and follow the road around, and you will find yourself amongst the hustle of the streets of Rome, with bars & restaurants aplenty! We managed to pack a lot into 2 days, but its simply too much for just one weekend! The hotel itself is very Grand in the inside and the rooms are well decorated (obviously I can only comment on our standard room). The reception staff were very helpfull and spoke good English. The shower was hot and powerful, with a bath (should you find the time). Tv had satelite (but didnt use it). Breakfast is conntinental and smelt great but.... we didnt take advantage! We out early and back very late, which is whats needed in order to explore this fantastic city as best you can! If looking for a hotel in Rome, acknowledge that the buildings are very old, and in some cases may not have the best veiws as the city wasnt built that way! My tip- Dont worry about the view from your room, get out amongst it as the views will blow you away!! The hotel Traiano is a great place to start!

Reviews.Title: “Some elegance but maybe aging less gracefully ?”
Reviews.Author: DenverDoctorMom
Reviews.Content: Arriving in Rome on the week where the first snow fell in 25 years, the Traiano staff were above lovely and did a phenomenal job managing complex arrangements for travelers. The location is fabulous, and the breakfast room has a remarkable ceiling. The lobby lounge is comfortable and the wireless works there without a hitch. The rooms are typically European-style and on the small side, and the heat in the winter works well. But the decor and features are a bit tired and worn. Paint and grout were less than fresh in the room, as were the carpet and bedspread. The linens were clean and refreshed each day and the attention from the housekeeping staff was excellent. The internet in the room, although worked beautifully on the first day, didn't work at all over the subsequent three days. All in all, a very good stay, but not luxurious. The kindness of these staff and the location outweighed any negatives in my book.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Paul G
Reviews.Content: Hotel Traiano is in a great location for visiting all Rome's major sites. Just a 10 minute walk to the Colosseum, and under 5 minutes to the Trevi fountain. The Hotel is very clean and the staff are extremely helpful and polite. I never experienced any problems and will definitely use them again when i return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: michael b
Reviews.Content: This hotel is within easy walking distance of many of Rome's visitor attractions, and a short taxi ride to others. The staff were all friendly and welcoming, and very helpful, and all spoke good English - though they appreciated my stumbling attempts at Italian! Our room was large enough, clean and had all the facilities we could want for a weekend stay. The breakfast is truly excellent, and the dining room decor beautiful. There have been reviews complaining about traffic noise and saying the hotel would benefit from some repair and painting. Yes, there was traffic noise, but remember the hotel is in the centre of a very busy city! Certainly we were not bothered by the traffic - just a background hum with the window closed - if anything it added to the atmosphere of being in a vibrant modern city, with ancient ruins. That is modern Rome. Redecoration? Well yes, the outside facade could do with a fresh coat of paint, mostly due to traffic grime I suspect, but pretty well every building in a modern city centre has this problem. The interior decor and furnishings could not be faulted. I will definitely return to this hotel next time I am in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “4*, Not exactly!”
Reviews.Author: KWMCA
Reviews.Content: Do not get the wrong idea about this hotel, i have stayed in a lot "better"4*,s If you meet Giuseppe De-Simone on the reception you will find him most helpful during your stay and very pleasant. Location; Fantastic. Noisy in front rooms, traffic all the time. Very good cont. breakfast, When booking I requested Gluten free bread and Soya milk and was presented with a tray of Gluten free goodies every morning at our table, Very,Very good service on this part.

Reviews.Title: “Does the job”
Reviews.Author: Hughf
Reviews.Content: Overnight stay before going on a cruise, Large comfortable bedroom - very quiet - free transfer to Cruise ship included in price. All good !

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nors93
Reviews.Content: Hotel Traiano is a very well located hotel - short walk to Trevi fountain and Capitol. It is on the main thoroughfare and our room was overlooking this which made it very noisy all night long. The hotel is old and in desperate need of modernisation but our room was large, clean and tidy. The bathroom was also clean. Hotel staff were pleasant and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “ok for what we needed it for”
Reviews.Author: CONSUMER6
Reviews.Content: We needed a hotel for a one night stay before our cruise. Hotel traiano offered a free shuttle and breakfast. We took the train from Rome then grabbed a cab to the hotel (cab should cost between 10-15 Euros) and checked in. The hotel was nice and suited our needs but the ac was a problem, and yes they did take the filter out but it didn’t help much. A clothes iron is available for use but no ironing board. If you’re up for a walk, just when you walk out the front door make a left and go straight. There is a small grocery store 2 blocks away. If you make a right at the grocery store and walk to the round about to your left and right there will be some restaurants, sandwich shops, ect.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mollopUk
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated very close to the forum and it is in easy walking distance to all the main sights. It is in a nice quiet location at night and we experienced no noise. The hotel room was very clean and had a lovely bathroom with a bath as well as a shower. This was welcome after a hot day! The room was small, but all rooms in Rome seem to have this problem! The beds were comfortable. The staff were very friendly, polite and efficient. They spoke fluent English and helped us with our Italian. I have recommended this hotel to my friend and clients as it is a real find.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and staff.”
Reviews.Author: EmmaFatz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally located, about a 10 minute walk from the Colosseum on one side and the Trevi Fountain on the other side. You can walk to most of the sights from the hotel and for those you cant the closest metro station is only a 10 minute walk. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly and the breakfast was very good, with a lot of variety. The only negative would be the dated decor of the rooms and the fact that the carpet was a little dirty. Overall though, a very pleasant stay and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Small, clean and quiet”
Reviews.Author: Fred255370
Reviews.Content: A really small room with a tiny bathroom, like most rooms in large cities, but you don't visit Rome to sit in a hotel room. There was a double bed but the room would have been really cramped with more than one in it. It was listed as a single room and was fine for one person. Other rooms in the hotel are larger. Very friendly staff, and a fantastic breakfast room. A great selection at breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Dale53
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located for access to all tourist attractions,but falls well below the standard of accommodation and service that we would normally expect in a 4* hotel. On our first night we were allocated a room which would not pass the criteria of a 2* room (room 312) and although this was remedied the following day after persistant complaining the upgraded room that we were subsequently allocated also fell below the standard expexted, noise and lack of air conditioning only added to the disappointment we experienced during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to complain about, perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: Varulla
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through our travel agency. We chose this one mainly because of the location, did not know what to expect of the rooms and service at all. The service was very good, our room was clean and beautiful. No view (all the windows opened to small dark courtyard) but soon we realized - it was a good thing! The noise of the street would not have let us sleep, we are quite sensitive to it. The ambulances in Rome have the worst sirens ever! :) Breakfast was tasty, amazing fresh little croissants, fruit cocktail, bread and cheese/ham. And we did not have to buy a single bus/metro ticket, most known tourist locations were in the walking distance. A perfect choice for us.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location & Service”
Reviews.Author: Baggers95
Reviews.Content: The Traiano Hotel was in an excellent location and ideally situated for the main tourist attractions that we wanted to visit - the Collosseum, Roman Forum, Palatine Hill, Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, Piazza di Venezia. Also just a short taxi ride to St Peters' Square, the Vatican and the Sistine Chapel. I would recommend getting a Taxi from Fiumicino Airport at a fixed cost of €40, rather than taking the Shuttle Bus which stops on the wrong side of town! The service at the Traiano Hotel was very good. The front of house staff were very polite and informative. The continental breakfast was plentiful and a good selection. I wouldn't say the hotel warranted a 4* rating - our room was clean and tidy, but the decor was a little dated. We didn't go to Rome to spend time in our hotel, so for us it was perfect and I would definately recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad At All”
Reviews.Author: yesiamsassy
Reviews.Content: While the Hotel itself is in OLD Rome and rather historic in it's location-The internal furnishings could use a little freshning up-with that said...the charm of the place definitely evens that out. Small elevator to other floors within the hotel but charming little alcoves as well as interesting hangins, fixtures and decorations make it rather charming-lots to look at while eating a decent but definitely lacking "continental" breakfast (food was okay-small selection and our cocoa (out of a machine) had dead ants in it).... The beds were small by US standards as well as the room but more than adequate for me, my parter and teenage we had with us. The bathroom was crowded but once again very adequate for people who are NOT there to spend their trip sitting in a hotel room. Noice-well noise is noise and you get it no matter where you are-i had NO problems with hearing randomly other guest (it happened but didnt keep me awake) nor did traffic sounds awake us. We did often hear ambulance or police ar sounds but the way the city is built..you hear those from MILES around and it was definitely not a distraction... While most of the desk staff was pleasant-there was one or two that could use a crash course in plesantness....but once again we were not their to socialize with the staff...we were there to see the sights which we did and we LOVED it!!! I would say this hotel is a 3.5 star and while not what you might expect being from the US it is not bad for the price nor the location nor it's accomodations!!

Reviews.Title: “Really not a memorable stay”
Reviews.Author: labarSanremo
Reviews.Content: Good location. For everything else not memorable : the hotel needs to be "refreshed" and does not seem to deserv four stars.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, friendly hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: StormEssex
Reviews.Content: just returned from a weekend in Rome, absolutely fantastic hotel, staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Location was excellent about a 10 minute walk to the Coloseum and Trevi Fountain. Looking at other hotels in the area I was really glad we chose this one as the location was fanatastic. As with many city hotels, you could hear traffic noise but you soon got used to it! Rooms were cleaned every day. Breakfast was croissants, pastries, rolls, cereal, yoghurt, tea, coffee, fresh orange juice. I would definitley recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the heart of Rome, a stone throw from Piazza Venezia!”
Reviews.Author: simmo888
Reviews.Content: Ive stayed at this hotel many times and have always been impressed. The price includes a buffet breakfast downstairs. Its simple but includes amazing fresh croissants and pastries... I think my partner ate one of every kind as they came out freshly baked abour every 10 mins! When staying at this hotel you need to do the usual tourist things because they are all so close.. i.e 5mins walk to Fountain of Trevi etc.. AND another must is to an ice cream at "Giolitti" and dinner at "Da Gino's" both are near the Parliment house (just walk around a bit in little lanes and side streets and you will find them.) Its so worth it. You will be inspired to write poetry after eating at Da Gino's! I thought my partner was going to break into song!! Its quite rustic and very inexpensive but your taste buds will be dancing! The waiters are all very entertaining too. Its very laid back, very Italian. Language is no barrier, just smile and let them know what you want (I recommend the involtini!!!) Anyway, Ice cream.... I missed an awesome photo opportunity at Giolitti where I spotted a young priest licking madly at this melting ice cream... its where the locals have there gelati!

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT location!”
Reviews.Author: westerfers
Reviews.Content: Staff was friendly and helpful. Breakfast was simple - pastries were delicious! Wifi wasn't free, you have to pay per hour. Room was small but it was clean. Sheets and towels were changed daily. We had a front room - it was very noisy due to traffic outside. Since it was chilly and rainy we were able to close windows at night, which helped with the noise. Price wasn't bad for such a great location, we were able to walk everywhere! I would recommend Hotel Traiano.

Reviews.Title: “Great location shame about the room.”
Reviews.Author: Lencawley
Reviews.Content: Great staff and a decent breakfast to get you started, I don't think you could get a better location the Trevi Fountain is 5 min walk in the back streets. 8 euro over to trastevere by cab, all pretty ok to be honest. Room was below average some genius decided to put the en-suite from the room next door beside ours. But thats all to complain about. Oh the water pressure in this hotel is way to high, i had read a few reviews here and got a feeling that this was a little problem. Being the intrepid engineer that I am, I got a good friend to create an adapter for the shower head so we could increase the pressure. My mechanical engineering buddie described it as a good sticking plaster for a poor system. Little did I know the pressure in the shower was too much really it was sore on the skin. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not a 4 star but a good location!”
Reviews.Author: tap_tapPrague
Reviews.Content: First we arrived to the hotel we were disappointed. We got a large room but it was very nasty, I was even afraid to step into the bath tub. The view was into the yard with air condition tubes. When we woke up in the morning we still thought it's night because the room was so dark!!! There was almost no difference if we had the curtains over the window or not! We really felt like in a tomb so we asked for another room. My boyfriend used to stay in this hotel before and so he said at the reception desk and they had no problems to give us a new room (more expensive one but they didn't charge us for that) although we had to move immediately so no time for packing our things back into the suitcase :-) it was a bit hectic :-) But the new room was nice. It was a lot smaller but we didn't mind at all because it was light, facing the street, with a balcony and a nice clean bathroom. We enjoyed it so much! We spent out evenings there, drinking italian wine and beer, watching the street.... Another problem was with ironing. We had our own small travel iron and ask for the reduction but the receptionist asked us for the reason and when he found out we want to use the iron, he didn't lend it to us. And he offered us an ironing service - 4 Euro per one t-shirt which we refused. The breakfast was nothing special but good enough to fill your stomach :-) The best on this hotel is its location, it's really almost in the center, that was really really awesome!! If we go to Rome again (which we certainly will) we will probably stay in this hotel but we ask for "our" room ;-)

Reviews.Title: “perfect central location”
Reviews.Author: buttercupMalaga
Reviews.Content: Yes,its not very grand and not perfect but it was a great location for us as we only had 4 days to "do" Rome.Yes ,the front rooms of the hotel were very noisy and we quickly changed to room 302(no view but we slept like logs!)The bed was clean and comfortable,we asked the chambermaid for extra pillows and an extra blanket which we duly recieved.There were fresh towels every day and the room was made up daily too.We could walk to the Colosseum and the Forum in 10-15 minutes.The Trevi fountain,Pantheon and The Spanish steps in 15 minutes and the day we went to the Vatican City we walked back-it took us 30 minutes.The breakfast was lovely,served from 7am untill 10 each day.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and great value”
Reviews.Author: Ipoxy
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a perfect location for a visit to Rome across the road from Forum of Trajan. We found the staff very friendly and helpful. The hotel could need some renovation but for the price we paid it was more than satisfying. The rooms were decent in size and had a very much appreciated air condition. The only thing I could point my finger at is that the pressure in the shower could be better, however I assume this was a temporary problem only in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Savior Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ItalyHMTrip
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel after a bad experience at our first hotel. The room and bath were very big for Italy standards. The air conditioning worked great depsite the hot temperatures outside. The staff was very helpful and i thought the price was very reasonable for what we got. Internet access is available in the hotel for a small fee. The location is not very close to subway transportation, but we enjoyed walking everywhere anyway.

Reviews.Title: “good stay”
Reviews.Author: lovetocookMoray
Reviews.Content: myself and my husband stayed in this hotel for 4 nights. we very much enjoyed our stay. we had room 310 which was to the side so didnt have traffic noise but there was a bit from the irish bar below. but the noise didnt last long at one time. we didnt spend long in the room so it didnt matter that the room was not big. the toilet was very close to the sink, but all was very clean and soap replaced every day (unexpected). we did have a few ants visiting each day, but only about 6 at one time, so just got rid of them. bed was comfortable nd sheets were changed after 2nd day. also lovely clean thick towels issued every day. staff in the hotel very helpful. at reception, managed to get a smile from the man at reception by asking for our key each day by saying the room no. in italien (well as best we could) he seemed to appreciate it! it wasnt a problem comin in at all hours! (everyone wanders about till really late). going up in the lift was a bit scary(barely enogh room for 2 people) on the whole we would stay there again if in rome as ideal for all tourist sights. lovely breakfast room. but my husband was dissapointed with the coffee,we didnt think to ask for fresh from staff. the hot chocolate from the machine was good. lots to choose from to eat. had brown and white continental rolls( brown not always supplied at other european hotels) the coissants were lovely, and small pastries were good too. there were different jams and also honey. we were sufficiently full to only buy a small snack at lunch time then have a good meal at night from nearby restaurants. overall a good place to stay, we paid 360 euros for 4 nights which we felt was worth it, booked through KLM with our flights.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: WORLDWIDE111
Reviews.Content: Okay a wonderfull hotel and location about 900 meters away from the colleso and 1km away from the spanish steps and around 600 metres to trevi fountain and 10meaters to TRajans Market. Everything on the hotels website is right and the rooms are exactly like whats on the website. Freindly staff and the breakfast was good. Breakfast conbsist ham,slamai,bread,eggs,yogurt,crearel,canned fruits . Caution if your room is near the Corks INN Irish Pub expect noise in the midnight only. THe decoration and statues are a nice addition and the wifi is only in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “hotel triano”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoRosebud
Reviews.Content: great size rooms, great staff. huge breakfast, free shuttle to cruise ship.

Reviews.Title: “Who Rates these Hotels ??????”
Reviews.Author: surprise50
Reviews.Content: A surprise weekend for my husbands 50th birthday...AND Hotel Traiano is full of surprises!!! The only direct comparison with the Hotels web page is the 'Front Door ' of the Hotel.The Bedroom was terrible, the bed was about 12" of the floor, with one pillow each and they were as flat as a board, carpet worn.curtains that were once white now grey ..The shower had a trickle of water which would go from hot to cold after a few minutes thenhot again..I would hate to think of the difficulties a larger guest might have trying to access the shower. Guisseppe at the front desk who would be off the next two days did everything to assure us that he would arrange a room change which came the next day.. The door to our 'new room' had been forced open at some stage and as we had our two children with us this was of grave concern to us, no satisfaction from the front desk so my husband for our remaining two night slept with part of their sofa bed against the door ..this made it very upsetting for the children as we had to continue to reassure them that the room was safe and daddy would not let anyone in..... Breakfast was your typical continental and certainly not worth the rush to the breakfast hall.. The location for the city centre is excellent but the disappointment when you open the bedroom door overshadows that..and the fact that other than Guisseppe being so lovely the others just fob you off as people complaining about the 'advertised facilities' that don't exist is all part of an normal day to them

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great value, great fun!”
Reviews.Author: TravellingEmm
Reviews.Content: I read some mixed reviews before staying here, but it was really good and I'd definitely recommend it. The location is excellent, slap bang in the middle of Rome, close to the Colosseum and Trevi Fountain. We walked everywhere, and enjoyed being able to wander into town and walk home easily and safely at any time of night. I'd definitely recommend staying centrally instead of by the train station. It is on a busy, main road, but our room was at the side and the double glazing cuts out all the noise. The room was clean, nice and a good size. Staff were friendly, helpful and spoke English. Our room had air-con (a necessity in the summer heat!) and a plasma sky tv. Breakfast was typical continental, with juice, water or tea/coffee to drink, bread, pastries, cheese, ham, boiled eggs, basic cereal, jams - we were quite happy. I can't think of anything bad to say about it, except it's maybe not quite 4 star by Uk standards, but great nonetheless.

Reviews.Title: “Saved us from a terrible holiday!”
Reviews.Author: Pelagia1
Reviews.Content: We went to Rome for a romantic city break, we booked this through a travel agent which is something we never do (we always book online) We arrived at our destination and got to the hotel the travel agent reccommended it was called Hotel Parker, it was the worst hotel I had ever set foot in the towels were like rags and it was just appalling in every way. We decided to get out of there and look for another hotel. We walked around Rome for about 2 hours looking for a room in 4 and 5 star hotels. Everywhere was so busy because it was Valentines.Finally we got to Hotel Traiano. They had a room for us!! We were delighted. The hotel was very clean and the receptionist was so friendly and helpful after we had been turned from so many other hotels! The room was very spacious and clean. The breakfast was fine and the staff were surperb. It is situated in front of the Roman Forum and very central - we walked nearly everywhere, but there is a bus service just around the corner. There are some sweet little restaurants close by. Four star hotels in Ireland are far superior to four star in Rome. This really should be a three star I think. But we had a lovely holiday, and they saved the day for us!!

Reviews.Title: “Smelly place”
Reviews.Author: MashaMoscow
Reviews.Content: The position of this hotel is very nice. And probably it was a nice hotel...around 40years ago... The room had a terrible smell. Bathroom was so small that it was almost impossible to close the door from inside. The telephone in the room was so uncomfortable, that it was impossible to keep it down, so it was always busy !!! Breakfast was shamefull, even not a normal espresso in Italy ! not to say about all the rest... But something wasn't bad anyway... Beside the nice position the hotel was quite clean and staff was friendly. (If not to take in consideration "False" transfer that they organized us.) Maria, from Moscow

Reviews.Title: “4 Star location...but NOT 4 star Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jenifer1987
Reviews.Content: (1)The Location:- The hotels location could not be better, it is central to all the main attractions... 10 minute walk to the colleseum and roman forum, and is central to all the main via's (roads) via del corso is worth a strole down, as all the main tourist attractions lead off this street, eg, spanish steps, trevi fountain etc.and shops that are affordable can be found situated here, - zara, miss sixty etc.Me and my partner found it easy to access all the main tourist sites from this hotel by foot. (2) The Hotel itself:- The staff are lovely and helpful, especailly Frabritizio on reception, he recommmended the best restaurants in roma, and was very happy to assist us with anything we wished to know. The hotel lobby and reception are well decorated, as well as the breakfast room, however there is NO restaurant, therefore No room-service. There is something of a 'bar' which consists of a single shelf with 4-6 bottels on and a coffee machine....- this is over exagerated in many websites for this hotel. The breakfast is continental - bread & butter, yoghurt and pure juices, i wouldnt waste your morning 'eating' there, and would just grab a bite to eat in one of the many beautiful piazza's. (3)The Rooms In the hotel are nothing like what the pictures show! The beds are roughly about 1ft off the floor and if you ask for a double bed you WILL get 2 singles just pushed together, we only got one pillow each, id say less if they were'nt as flat as a hankerchief! The tv's are something dated from the 1800's and was constantly fuzzy and had no volume control .. + NO Remote. ....it resembled something of a shoe box, that small and pointless to have. The shower flooded the bathroom and we were woken each morning about 8am by maids hoovering up! which eventually gets annoying. The central location of the hotel makes it rather noisy outside, but its not much of a problem. We also found our air-con didnt work too. Overall, you couldnt get a better centrally located hotel than this, which is the only reason why I would stay here again, however, the poor conditon of the rooms will keep us away on our return to rome.What makes this a 4 star hotel .. i really dont no.......

Reviews.Title: “Decent value for your money...”
Reviews.Author: suneelupadhye
Reviews.Content: Hotel Traiano was clean, with courteous staff. Room was small but clean, bathroom well groomed. My room (2 nights) was on the street but not too noisy with the windows closed. Usual continental breakfast, good quality (no hot foods though). Center of the action to sight-seeing, easy to walk to all major sites and the shopping district. Knowing what I know now, I'd likely stay out of Rome center and take excellent public transport trains into the center of action. Local restaurants were way over-priced, under-portioned and not very tasty...I ate much better after I left city-center...Overall OK for a first time visitor, but you can probably find cheaper yet just as accessible a little ways out...

Reviews.Title: “Try somewhere else first. But excellent location”
Reviews.Author: pmerickson
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after arriving in Rome. The hotel we reserved was near the train station and not as close to the sights as we would have liked. After a while, we realized why this hotel had vacancies in the middle of the busy tourist season. We had two rooms for 4 nights,so we spent a considerable amout. The rooms are small, but very clean. However, someone staying at the hotel (or perhaps one of the staff) smoked (there is a new law in Italy that no smoking is allowed inside hotels). Our entire floor reaked of cigarette smoke that definately infiltrated our room. We complained numerous times but the staff just insisted that there was no smoking allowed in Italy's hotels. The night clerk just dismissed this and told us to talk to the morning staff. Because we wanted two adjacent rooms, we did not request a change. Also, our rooms were in the back of the hotel which backs up to a small alley with a bar. This bar is obviously a favorite spot for tourists,because it was so loud from about 11pm-2am every night that we could not sleep. It was nice that breakfast was included, but it was mediocre at best. The coffee was instant from a machine and was not very good (although the staff would bring fresh coffee (Italian) on request. The orange juice was really artificial, but the pastries were good. They did not provide fresh fruit for breakfast. The location was the hotel's best feature. We were able to walk to all of the major sights; no need to board one of the packed buses! Definately do not stay at this hotel; it is not worthy of its 4-star rating. With a few changes, they could improve.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for a brief stay”
Reviews.Author: sp_gala
Reviews.Content: Spent a couple nights there on business. As mentioned in other reviews the location is great - near the major sights. I must have been a bit unlucky as my room was small and unfortunately opened onto the main road which turned out to be a nightmare. I practically felt like I was sleeping on the sidewalk. Extremely noisy. However I was only there for a couple nights. The room was small as mentioned but clean. Breakfast was Ok with the usual cold cuts, yogurt, cereals, etc. The hotel is a bit aged but not really an issue. The front desk was courteous and helpful. All in all OK for a couple nights - just try to get a room internally.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Joe B
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel with very friendly staff. Room was large with bedroom and living room with pull out coach. Bathroom was small but did the job. Great location, right by the Via Nationale, which is a great shopping district and has great restaurants nearby. Pricey if your on a budget but worth the stay. Breakfast was great for a Euro Hotel because it had a very large array of foods. Local places to stop at: Rockadile bar, you get to sit on the floor in a dark, spooky bar....its great. Restaurant Zeus, try the desert.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: MPS_VP
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Traiano for five days last week. I was just delighted about the quality, given the price we paid. I think we got the best room in the hotel (by accident): room 211. It's fairly big and the only room with a big, walk out balcony. We faced a busy street but the sound-proofing was excellent; zero trafffic noise. Anyhow, the location was great, the room was just fine, maid service was above average, the staff were friendly and responsive and breakfast was quite acceptable (although a bit more fresh fruit would be nice). For tourist stuff, the location could not be better. Compared to other comparably priced hotels in Rome or in other parts of Europe, this place was great.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: sgwalklate
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we were shown to our room which was not too bad a size, but not as big as others in the hotel. Within the first hour we found that the toilet was leaking and that ants were entering the room via what appeared to be a gap in the wall from outside. We complained to the manager who showed us the only free room in the hotel which was roughly half the size of our existing room. Also, the lock on the door did not work so we decided to stay in the existing room for safety reasons. The toilet was fixed within an hour but nothing could be done about the ants. As we didn't plan on staying in the room much, we could live with the odd ant appearing. The hotel is also on a busy main road which meant that everytime a bus went by outside the entire building shook. This went on all day up until about midnight. The hotel also appeared to be undergoing a refurbishment which meant that the hallways didn't look at their best. As for the location, the hotel is close to everything with the furthest thing away being the Vatican at about a 30 minute walk. So would we recommend this hotel, for the location yes, for the hotel itself, no. Before we went it was advertised as a 4 star, it's more like a 2 star.

Reviews.Title: “What's all the fuss about?”
Reviews.Author: Hotelmark
Reviews.Content: When I looked at other reviews, I wondered if I had made the right choice. Thankfully I was right! The location was brilliant and was really close to a lot of the main tourist areas. The roads around the hotel were a bit noisy but what do you expect in the middle of a large city. The rooms were very clean and even though there was some renovation going on in the corridors, it wasn't inconvenient. The breakfast room was amazing and you should take the opportunity to see it. The breakfast itself was fine-the usual selection from a continental breakfast. I agree with other reviews that the coffee and fruit juices weren't fantastic, but I tend not to allow the small things ruin my holiday! Besides, they weren't that bad! As for the staff, they were all polite and helpful and spoke english. If I return to Rome, I was seriously consider going back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Poor hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Traiano with my girlfreind for 3 nights at the end of March. The hotel is in a great location, just moments from Traian's column and the Forum. A maximum 10 min walk to the Collesum and about the same to the Trevi fountain. However, it is not a four star hotel. The decor dated and tired. The TV didn't work. Our bath didn't have a plug and despite asking for one two or three times, we never got one. The decor in the public areas is quite grand but it is faded grandour at best. It wasn't an aweful place. The things that mattered were ok; it was clean enough, the bed was ok, the breakfast was ok, the shower was good, the hairdryer in the bathroom worked, our towels were replaced and it is good to be that central, but think more 2 star or 3 star.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel in the perfect place! The Hotel is located in the perfect spot, between Trevi fountain (5 min walking) and colosseum (5 min walking), right in front of the roman forum. The rooms are really nice, very clean and with a fantastic view.The breakfast room is terrific and the food is good,if you don't like the machine coffe or juices just ask the lady and she will offer you a great italian coffe or cappuccino. Staff is very friendly and can give you the right solution to any problem and good adresses for restaurants. We really enjoyed our stay at the Traiano and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel experience ever.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After a beautiful stay in Sicily over the Christmas, my wife and I and our 11 month old baby boy headed for a few days in Rome. At the airport the incredibly inneficient tourist information desk encouraged us to book into this hotel. Aside from a friendly greeting on arrival this was our worst hotel experience ever. The room was dirty, our baby picked up cigarette butts from the floor, the bed linen was scattered with previous guests hairs and all this for 300 euro for the night !. We had booked the suite in fairness, but I can't imagine how bad a standard room would be. When I complained to the night porter, I was told there was nothing he could do and I should talk to the front desk in the morning. On the morning of 2nd January the man at the front desk was ignorant and offhand and did not want to listen to my issues. This is not the way to treat customers. To cap it all we had to get a taxi to the next hotel and he watched as we carried our luggage and infant out in the rain without even the slightest offer of assistance. We then moved to the St. Regis Grand Hotel for an extra 25 euro a night and it was literally like moving from Hell to Heaven. Do not put yourselves through the pain !.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Tori81
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the four star Traiano for four nights in late Sept 2005. I agree with an earlier review that this is not a four star standard. Our room was nice enough, but the bathroom was only ok. Everything was functional, but not of a high standard. If you get a room towards the street you can forget about sleeping. The noise from the traffic is relentless throughout the night. The location is excellent, the room is OK and the breakfast is average. The staff were excellent and nothing was too much trouble. The beds were comfortable and the cleanliness/towel change was first class. When we asked for extra pillows they almost beat us back to the room and changing rooms from front to back was easy (But the room at the back had an awful outlook). Generally I would not dissuade anyone from using the Traiano but they ask a high price for what is really a 2-3 star hotel. The location was very good Trevi and Via Nationale shopping (5-10 mins walking) Spanish Steps, Pantheon, Navona and Campo Dei Fiori all 15 mins walking. Vatican get the 110 bus around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: One of the worst hotel I have ever seen. It does not even merit two stars. We went there for a beautiful romantic long week-end and the hotel was a big disappointment. Positive points are the location and the concierge's friendliness and willingness to help. The room was small, the TV was not working (we were then told it was because of the rain and a problem with the antenna - it was of course the same the next sunny day plus the guide mentions Sky Satellite TV!). The breakfast was included in the price of the room but, unfortunately, was awful as well: coffee was with a machine and with no taste (you would expect at least a decent coffee in Italy), bread could not be toasted, orange juice was of course not fresh and the waitress could not be more friendly. Thanks to the hotel, we at least spent day and evening outside visiting the City and really enjoyed it. Definitely not a recommendation!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: mack6433
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Traiano for 3 nights and thought it was great. The staff was very helpful at all times. They arranged for a driver to pick us up at the airport and drive us to the hotel, helped us figure out how to use a phone card, called cabs for us, let us eat breakfast late after oversleeping the first morning, etc. The rooms were a little small, but extremely clean and the bathrooms were very nice and modern. The rooms had windows facing the traffic, but we were so tired after sightseeing all day we had no problem falling asleep. Breakfasts were good, and included crossaints, bread, cheese, meats, eggs, juice and a coffee machine that could make several types of coffee. We had a view of Trajan's Market out the window. This hotel is in a great location for travelers. It is within walking distance of Roman Forum, Colosseum, Palatine Hill, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Pantheon, Piazza Navona, etc. It was 5 euros for a cab ride to the Vatican City. We really enjoyed our stay here and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Bjorn
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the four star Traiano for two night in early May 2005. I agree with an earlier review that this is not a four star standard. Our room was nice enough, but the bathroom had seen better days. Everything was functional, but in a sorry state. If you get a room towards the street you can entirely forget about sleeping. The noise from the traffic is relentless throughout the night. The location is excellent, the room is OK and the breakfast is not. Next time I will go back to Hotel Campo di Fiori.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 Star Hotel - Don't Stay Here!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel over New Years. It was listed as a 4 star hotel. That is ridiculous. It was a 1 or 2 star hotel. Good Things: The gentlemen who worked the front desk was terrific. He was helpful and friendly, gave us great recommendations. He was wonderful. This hotel is in a great location. You can walk to pretty much everything (Via Veneto, Spanish Steps, Coliseum, Emanuel Vittorio, etc). You cannot walk to the Vatican (take the bus). Our room cost 100 euros a night. Bad Things: Our room was gross. The bed had two dips in it from where people had slept for the past several decades. The sheets and bedspread were so old, probably just as old as the mattress. The furniture and rug were also very outdated and very ugly. It seems our room has not been updated or cleaned since the Coliseum was built (ha-ha). This hotel is located on a very busy road and it's very noisy at night. We couldn't sleep at all. The elevator was about the size of a phone booth and it made some very scary sounds. A person cannot fit in there with their luggage. We had to send our luggage up separately and run up the stairs to meet the elevator to get our luggage. The room was the size of a closet. This hotel was so bad that we checked out and stayed at a different hotel. We couldn't sleep in the bed because it was so old and had the dips in it. I'm sure that there were lots of bed bugs in the bed. We couldn't go another night without sleep. We checked out and went to the Capo d'Africa hotel which we loved.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Battersea, London but from Melbourne, Australia
Reviews.Title: “Top marks for the Trai!”
Reviews.Author: Calm-Identity
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a mid winter's break in Rome (Jan 2005) and spent a wonderful weekend at the Hotel Traiano. The Hotel Traiano is right in the heart of Rome with Via Nazionale at the top of the hill (nice shopping street), Piazza Venezia, Trajan's Column, The Colosseo, Roman Forum, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps and Via del Corso (another nice shopping street). It took us about 20 minutes to walk from Termini Station to the Traiano but we could have taken a shorter time, if we weren't distracted by all the shops on Via Nazionale =) Vatican City and other sites of Rome are well catered for by the Buses that run in front of the hotel or do what we did and just walk it and enjoy the stroll on via Vittoria Emanuelle II. It took us about 45 - 50 minutes to walk from the Traiano. The hotel itself is elegantly decorated with a hint of art deco designs on the hotel room doors and the bathrooms. We did have a room facing via Novembre (the main street outside the hotel) and yes you do hear the traffic outside but that can be easily fixed by closing the shutters and drawing the blinds. The reception and hotel staff were all very professional, friendly and courteous which made our stay at the Hotel Traiano even more enjoyable. Top marks for the Trai!!

Reviews.Title: “Be warned!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel on the internet for it's location, 4 star rating and promise of a full English Breakfast. Sadly little of this was true except location. It is situated on a main road and the facade goes round three corners. The breakfast was cold buffet breakfast, not full English but more to the point was the condition of the Hotel. Having stayed in many 4 star hotels in the Uk, Europe and Australia I have come to expect a minimum standard. Sadly this Hotel should be no more than 3 star verging down to 2! There is no real lobby to speak of and only a minimum waiting area. The bar is the size of two cars but the biggest letdown is the decor. This Hotel looks like it has not been redecorated for at least 15-20 years. Fittings do not reflect a 4 star rating nor do staff levels. In the dining room there was only one staff to deal with all clients. Very poor, and the equipment in the dining room was also very old. My biggest gripe is the cost. I paid 760 euros to stay for 4 nights in september 2004 and when I saw some of the Hotels in the Via Natzionale that were charging similar amounts it made my heart bleed. Not a good Hotel at all.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Traiano
HotelInfo.Address: Via IV Novembre, 154, 00187 Rome, Italy
